responsible_practices_for_travelers: **Respect the Environment:** Do not litter. Stick to marked trails in natural parks and desert areas. Do not touch or stand on coral reefs when snorkeling or diving. Use reef-safe sunscreen.
**Conserve Resources:** Be mindful of water and energy consumption, especially in desert regions or remote areas. Reuse towels and opt out of daily linen changes in hotels if possible.

**Ethical Animal Interactions:** Avoid activities that exploit animals, such as camel or horse rides where the animals appear to be ill-treated or overworked. Do not engage with street vendors offering photo opportunities with captive animals (e.g., snakes, monkeys). Prioritize observing marine life in its natural habitat rather than supporting captive animal shows (like dolphin shows).

**Cultural Sensitivity:** Always seek permission before photographing individuals, especially women and children. Dress modestly when visiting local areas and religious sites. Engage respectfully with locals, learn a few Arabic phrases, and be open to cultural differences.
**Reduce Plastic Waste:** Carry a reusable water bottle and refill it when possible to minimize single-use plastic. Dispose of waste responsibly.
transportation: inter_city Domestic flights are the fastest way to cover long distances between major cities. Overnight sleeper trains operate between Cairo and Luxor/Aswan. Long-distance buses connect many cities efficiently
intra_city Taxis are abundant; always agree on a fare before starting your journey. apps like Uber and Careem are operational in Cairo, Alexandria, and some other major cities.

cultural_etiquette_tips.dress_code: Dress modestly, especially when visiting religious sites and local areas...
cultural_etiquette_tips.greetings: A simple 'Salam alaykum' is a polite greeting. 'Shukran' means thank you.
cultural_etiquette_tips.bargaining: Bargaining is expected in markets and smaller shops...
cultural_etiquette_tips.tipping_baksheesh: Baksheesh is an ingrained part of Egyptian culture...
cultural_etiquette_tips.photography: Always ask permission before taking photos of people, especially women...

description: Egypt is a transcontinental country linking northeast Africa with the Middle East, known for its ancient civilization, iconic monuments, and the Nile River.
location: Located in North Africa, bordered by the Mediterranean Sea to the north and the Red Sea to the east.
attractions: Valley of the Kings in Luxor
Red Sea Resorts (Hurghada, Sharm El Sheikh)
weather: Hot and dry in summer, mild in winter. Generally very hot across most of the country in June, especially in Upper Egypt.

description: Cairo is Egypt's bustling capital, rich in Islamic and ancient history.
location: Located on the eastern banks of the Nile in northern Egypt.
weather: Hot and dry in June. Average daytime temperature around 35-40°C, nighttime around 20-25°C. Can exceed 40°C during heatwaves.

description: Alexandria is a Mediterranean port city founded by Alexander the Great.
location: Located on Egypt's northern coast along the Mediterranean Sea.
weather: Hot and dry in June with refreshing sea breezes. Average daytime temperature around 29-31°C, nighttime around 20-23°C. Occasional heatwaves can push temperatures above 40°C. Average wind speed around 20-27 km/h.

description: Luxor is an ancient city known as the world’s greatest open-air museum.
location: Located in southern Egypt on the east bank of the Nile.
weather: Extremely hot and dry in June. Average daytime temperature around 41°C, nighttime around 22°C.

description: Aswan is a quiet Nile-side city rich in Nubian culture and natural beauty.
location: Located in southern Egypt along the Nile River.
weather: Extremely hot and dry in June. Average daytime temperature around 42°C, nighttime around 27°C. Almost no rainfall, average wind speed 4 m/s (14.4 km/h).

description: Taba is a small Egyptian town on the northern tip of the Gulf of Aqaba.
location: Located in eastern Sinai, near the Israeli border.
attractions: Pharaoh’s Island and Salah El-Din Citadel
Diving and Snorkeling in the Gulf of Aqaba
weather: Very hot and dry in June. Temperatures typically high, with cool evenings due to desert climate.

description: Hurghada is a vibrant Red Sea resort town known for its beaches and coral reefs.
location: Located on the western shore of the Red Sea in eastern Egypt.
weather: Very hot and dry in June. Average daytime temperature around 33°C, but feels hotter with humidity. Pleasant sea breezes.

description: Sharm El-Sheikh is a major Red Sea resort city known for luxury tourism and marine life.
location: Located on the southern tip of the Sinai Peninsula.
weather: Very hot and dry in June. Average daytime temperature around 36°C, but feels hotter with humidity. Pleasant sea breezes.

description: Faiyum is one of Egypt’s oldest cities, rich in archaeological and natural beauty.
location: Located southwest of Cairo in a large depression of the Western Desert.
weather: Very hot and dry in June. Temperatures typically high, with clear skies.

description: Dahab is a laid-back beach town popular with backpackers and divers.
location: Located on the southeast coast of the Sinai Peninsula.
weather: Very hot and dry in June. Average daytime temperature around 34°C, nighttime around 25°C. Water temperature around 26°C. Almost no rainfall, average wind speed around 14 km/h.

description: Siwa is a remote oasis known for its Berber culture, hot springs, and salt lakes.
location: Located in the Western Desert near the Libyan border.
weather: Extremely hot and dry in June. Temperatures can be very high during the day, with cooler desert nights.

description: Port Said is a canal city with colonial architecture and maritime heritage.
location: Located at the northern entrance of the Suez Canal on the Mediterranean coast.
weather: Hot and dry in June, moderated by sea breezes. Temperatures typically high, but more pleasant than inland areas.

description: Suez is a strategic port city and industrial center near the Red Sea.
location: Located at the southern end of the Suez Canal.
weather: Hot and dry in June, with high humidity near the coast. Temperatures typically high.

description: Al Minya is a historical city in Upper Egypt with ancient ruins and Coptic heritage.
location: Located on the west bank of the Nile River in central Egypt.
weather: Really hot and dry in June. Average daytime temperature around 38°C, nighttime around 22°C. Can feel slightly windy.

description: Ismailia is a peaceful city on the Suez Canal with green parks and colonial charm.
location: Located halfway along the Suez Canal between Port Said and Suez.
weather: Hot and dry in June, with high humidity due to proximity to the canal and lake.

description: Asyut is a large Upper Egyptian city known for its cultural and religious heritage.
location: Located on the west bank of the Nile River in central Egypt.
weather: Extremely hot and dry in June. Average daytime temperature around 39°C, nighttime around 25°C.

description: The iconic ancient wonders, including the Great Pyramid of Khufu, Pyramid of Khafre, and Pyramid of Menkaure. The last remaining Ancient Wonder of the World.
weather: Hot and dry in June. Average daytime temperature around 35-40°C, nighttime around 20-25°C. Can exceed 40°C during heatwaves. Clear skies.

description: Home to the Step Pyramid of Djoser, the oldest complete stone building in the world, and various mastabas (ancient tombs).
weather: Hot and dry in June. Average daytime temperature around 35-40°C, nighttime around 20-25°C. Can feel slightly windy. Clear skies.

description: Site of the Bent Pyramid and the Red Pyramid, early examples of pyramid construction.
weather: Hot and dry in June. Average daytime temperature around 35-38°C, nighttime around 24-26°C. Can feel slightly windy. Clear skies. Hot weather expected, recommended to drink plenty of water.

description: A vast open-air museum and the largest ancient religious site in the world, featuring massive halls, obelisks, and statues.
weather: Extremely hot and dry in June. Average daytime temperature around 41°C, nighttime around 22°C.

description: Beautifully illuminated at night, this temple was once connected to Karnak by an avenue of sphinxes.
weather: Extremely hot and dry in June. Average daytime temperature around 41°C, nighttime around 22°C.

description: The burial ground for pharaohs of the New Kingdom, including Tutankhamun's tomb.
weather: Extremely hot and dry in June. Average daytime temperature around 41°C, nighttime around 22°C.

description: Burial site for queens and royal children, notably the Tomb of Nefertari.
weather: Extremely hot and dry in June. Average daytime temperature around 41°C, nighttime around 22°C.

description: A stunning terraced temple dedicated to the female pharaoh Hatshepsut.
weather: Extremely hot and dry in June. Average daytime temperature around 41°C, nighttime around 22°C.

description: Two massive stone statues of Pharaoh Amenhotep III.
weather: Extremely hot and dry in June. Average daytime temperature around 41°C, nighttime around 22°C. No refreshing sea breeze.

description: Houses a remarkable collection of artifacts from the Theban region.
attractions: Royal Mummies of Ahmose I and Ramesses I
weather: Extremely hot and dry in June. Average daytime temperature around 41°C, nighttime around 22°C.

description: A well-preserved temple with intricate reliefs depicting military campaigns and religious scenes.
weather: Extremely hot and dry in June. Average daytime temperature around 41°C, nighttime around 22°C.

description: Known for its beautifully preserved reliefs and the Abydos King List, which provides a chronological list of most dynastic pharaohs.
weather: Really hot and dry in June. Average daytime temperature around 40°C, nighttime around 23°C. Can feel slightly windy. Relative humidity around 19%.

description: One of the best-preserved temples in Egypt, dedicated to the goddess Hathor, with stunning astrological ceilings.
weather: Extremely hot and dry in June. Average daytime temperature around 41°C, nighttime around 23°C.

description: A beautiful temple complex relocated to Agilkia Island to save it from the Aswan High Dam. Dedicated to the goddess Isis.
weather: Extremely hot and dry in June. Average daytime temperature around 42°C, nighttime around 27°C.

description: Two massive rock-cut temples dedicated to Ramses II and his wife Nefertari, famously relocated to save them from flooding.
weather: Really hot and dry in June. Average daytime temperature around 41°C, nighttime around 25°C. Can feel slightly windy.

description: A giant obelisk still attached to the bedrock in a granite quarry, providing insight into ancient quarrying techniques.
weather: Extremely hot and dry in June. Average daytime temperature around 42°C, nighttime around 27°C.

description: A modern marvel of engineering that controls the Nile's floods and created Lake Nasser.
weather: Extremely hot and dry in June. Average daytime temperature around 42°C, nighttime around 27°C.

description: Experience the colorful culture, unique architecture, and hospitality of the Nubian people.
weather: Extremely hot and dry in June. Average daytime temperature around 42°C, nighttime around 27°C.

description: The resting place of Aga Khan III, with stunning views of the Nile.
weather: Extremely hot and dry in June. Average daytime temperature around 38-39°C, nighttime around 25-27°C.

description: Houses the world's largest collection of ancient Egyptian artifacts, including the treasures of Tutankhamun. (GEM is planned to be the main national museum.)
weather: Hot and dry in June. Average daytime temperature around 35-40°C, nighttime around 20-25°C.

description: A UNESCO World Heritage site filled with medieval mosques, madrassas, and historical buildings.
weather: Hot and dry in June. Average daytime temperature around 35-40°C, nighttime around 20-25°C. Can exceed 40°C during heatwaves.

description: A medieval Islamic fortress with panoramic views of Cairo, home to the Mosque of Muhammad Ali.
weather: Hot and dry in June. Average daytime temperature around 35-36°C, nighttime around 21-22°C.

description: A vibrant and historic market for souvenirs, spices, traditional crafts, and street food.
weather: Hot and dry in June. Average daytime temperature around 35-40°C, nighttime around 20-25°C.

description: A historic area with ancient churches, including the Hanging Church, Church of St. Sergius and Bacchus, and Ben Ezra Synagogue.
attractions: Hanging Church (Saint Virgin Mary's Coptic Orthodox Church)
Church of St. Sergius and Bacchus
weather: Hot and dry in June. Average daytime temperature around 35-40°C, nighttime around 20-25°C.

description: Features a magnificent 'Mummies Royal Hall' showcasing royal mummies in a state-of-the-art facility.
weather: Hot and dry in June. Average daytime temperature around 35-40°C, nighttime around 20-25°C.

description: Offers panoramic views of the city from its observation deck.
weather: Hot and dry in June. Average daytime temperature around 30-40°C, occasionally reaching 50°C. Typically very hot.

description: A modern architectural marvel honoring the ancient Library of Alexandria, serving as a major cultural center.
weather: Hot and dry in June, moderated by sea breezes. Average daytime temperature around 26-31°C, occasional heatwaves can exceed 40°C.

description: A 15th-century fortress built on the site of the ancient Lighthouse of Alexandria.
weather: Hot and dry in June, moderated by sea breezes. Average daytime temperature around 29-31°C, nighttime around 20-23°C.

description: A Roman-era necropolis with a unique blend of Egyptian, Roman, and Greek art and architecture.
weather: Hot and dry in June, moderated by sea breezes. Average daytime temperature around 29-31°C, nighttime around 20-23°C.

description: A massive Roman column, part of the ancient Serapion complex.
weather: Hot and dry in June, moderated by sea breezes. Average daytime temperature around 29-31°C, nighttime around 20-23°C.

description: Remains of a Roman theater in the city center, offering insight into ancient entertainment.
weather: Hot and dry in June, moderated by sea breezes. Average daytime temperature around 29-31°C, nighttime around 20-23°C.

description: Beautiful gardens surrounding a former royal palace (Montaza Palace), offering a peaceful escape.
weather: Hot and dry in June, moderated by sea breezes. Average daytime temperature around 29-31°C, nighttime around 20-23°C.

description: Experience the beauty of the Nile while visiting ancient temples and tombs along its banks.
weather: Extremely hot and dry in June, with temperatures consistently very high. Average daytime temperature around 41-42°C.

location: Hurghada, Sharm El Sheikh, Dahab, Marsa Alam
description: A paradise for diving, snorkeling, and beach holidays with vibrant coral reefs and diverse marine life.
weather: Very hot and dry in June, with high humidity. Average daytime temperatures typically range from 33-36°C, with pleasant sea breezes. Water temperatures are ideal for swimming.

description: A protected area at the southern tip of the Sinai Peninsula, renowned for its diverse marine life and coral reefs.
weather: Very hot and dry in June, with high humidity. Average daytime temperature around 36°C, but feels hotter with humidity.

description: Popular for day trips, snorkeling, diving, and relaxing on pristine sandy beaches.
weather: Very hot and dry in June, with high humidity. Average daytime temperature around 33°C, but feels hotter with humidity. Ideal for water activities.

description: A surreal landscape with chalk rock formations sculpted by wind, creating unique 'mushroom' and 'ice cream cone' shapes.
weather: Extremely hot and dry in June during the day, with significant temperature drops at night characteristic of desert climates.

description: A remote and unique oasis with ancient ruins, salt lakes, hot springs, and a distinct Berber culture.
attractions: Temple of the Oracle (Temple of Amun)
weather: Extremely hot and dry in June during the day, with significant temperature drops at night characteristic of desert climates.

description: A UNESCO World Heritage site famous for its exceptionally preserved fossilized whale skeletons from an ancient ocean.
weather: Very hot and dry in June, with high daytime temperatures.

description: A significant religious site, believed to be where Moses received the Ten Commandments. Many hike to the summit for sunrise.
weather: Hot and dry in June during the day. Nights can be cool due to altitude.

location: Sinai Peninsula, at the foot of Mount Sinai
description: One of the oldest continuously inhabited Christian monasteries in the world, home to invaluable manuscripts and icons.
weather: Hot and dry in June during the day. Nights can be cool due to altitude. Average daytime temperature around 30-36°C, nighttime around 20-22°C.

description: A natural geological formation with stunning rock colors and formations, perfect for hiking and exploring.
weather: Hot and dry in June. Temperatures can be very high, especially within the canyon.

description: A historic port city at the northern entrance of the Suez Canal, known for its colonial-era architecture.
weather: Hot and dry in June, moderated by sea breezes. Temperatures typically high, but more pleasant than inland areas.

description: A seaport city at the southern end of the Suez Canal, historically significant.
weather: Hot and dry in June, with high humidity near the coast. Temperatures typically high.

description: A charming city on the west bank of the Suez Canal, known for its green spaces and French colonial architecture.
weather: Hot and dry in June, with high humidity due to proximity to the canal and lake.

description: A beautiful Mediterranean coastal city with stunning clear waters and pristine beaches.
weather: Hot and dry in June, with refreshing sea breezes. Temperatures are generally pleasant compared to inland cities.
